previewParagraphs: The Goffertstadion will set the stage for an intriguing Eredivisie clash as high-flying Nijmegen look to continue their strong run with Utrecht hoping to stabilize their form. Both sides bring distinct trends into the contest, and recent history offers insights into how this battle might unfold.

Nijmegen have put together an impressive string of results in their last six outings, securing four wins and drawing twice, while keeping their loss column untouched. Over this period, they have averaged nearly three goals per match, showing attacking prowess balanced by a defense conceding just under two. At home, they have won two and drawn one of their last three, scoring 2.33 per match and conceding just one.

Utrecht’s recent form tells a different story. In their last six, they have managed only one win alongside three draws and two defeats, scoring an average of 1.33 and conceding by the same measure. On the road, their ability to grind out points is visible, with a pattern of draws but not enough victories to climb the table.

The last three encounters between these teams have tipped slightly in Utrecht’s favor, with Nijmegen managing one victory while Utrecht have claimed the other two. However, the close nature and fluctuating outcomes serve as a reminder that previous meetings have been tight affairs.

After 17 league matches, Nijmegen find themselves well-placed in fourth with 8 wins, 5 draws, and 4 losses. Their tally of 43 goals—an average of 2.53 per game—shows the team’s attacking identity under Rogier Meijer. They have conceded 29, resulting in a strong +14 goal difference.

Utrecht sit eighth with a much more modest record: 6 wins, 5 draws, and 6 losses. They average 1.65 goals scored and have conceded 1.35 per match, for a goal difference of +5 after 17 played. Their campaign has included patches of resilience but also long spells without wins.

Nijmegen’s main trends speak of a side difficult to beat. They have been undefeated in 16 of their last 20 matches across all competitions, and bring a 7 match undefeated run into this fixture. At home, they are even more formidable—20 games unbeaten in their last 25. Additionally, there is a positive record when winning by two or more goals, which has occurred in 39% of their last 23 matches.

Utrecht’s story is less positive, as they have not secured a win in 16 of their past 20 matches across all competitions. Draws have featured prominently, with 5 in their last 10. Away from home, they have drawn in half of their last six but have gone winless in 9 out of 11—highlighting their lack of an away breakthrough.

previewParagraphs: Union Berlin prepare to face Mainz at Stadion An der Alten Försterei with both sides seeking turning points for their Bundesliga campaigns. Union are looking to consolidate a midtable spot, while Mainz desperately need points to climb off the foot of the table. Both managers have crucial choices to make with personnel and tactics, and recent meetings suggest a competitive, tactical contest awaits.

Union Berlin’s recent run has been mixed. In their last six matches, they have won three and lost three, averaging 1.5 goals per game while conceding the same. Their performance at home has also been patchy, with just one win from the last three home matches and two defeats, scoring and conceding an average of two goals per match.

Mainz, on the other hand, continue to grapple with poor form. They have won only once in their last six, drawn three, and lost two, scoring an average of just 0.83 goals per game while conceding 1.33. Their away performances reflect broader problems, as they have failed to secure a win in 82% of their last 11 away matches in all competitions.

The head-to-head record offers little comfort for Mainz. Across the last 10 encounters, Union Berlin have emerged victorious six times, while Mainz have managed just a single win, with the remaining three ending in draws. Union’s dominance is further underlined by their overall edge across the last 20 meetings.
Looking more closely at Union’s recent home matches against Mainz, there’s a clear advantage: Union have won by a margin of two or more goals in 50% of the last six home encounters in this fixture.

Union hold 8th place after 15 matches, having won six, drawn three, and lost six, with a negative goal difference of minus three. They average 1.33 goals per game, but have conceded more often than they might like.

Mainz sit at the bottom in 18th with just one win all season from 15 games, five draws, and nine losses. Their struggle offensively is signaled by only 13 goals scored and a leaky defense, conceding 26. Their goal difference stands at minus 13.

Union’s last six matches in all competitions feature a perfectly balanced outcome—three wins and three losses, but their home form is showing signs of stress. Five of their last six home matches in all competitions have ended without victory. However, they have avoided defeat in five of their last six Bundesliga home games, suggesting a greater stubbornness on their own turf in league matches.

Mainz are currently winless in 13 of their last 16 matches across all competitions, and they have failed to win in 24 of their last 30 Bundesliga outings—sobering figures by any standard. The visitors have drawn 50% of their last eight Bundesliga games, but failing to convert draws into wins is costly. Notably, Mainz have not won any of their last 12 home matches in the Bundesliga but take a four-game undefeated streak in all competitions into this fixture, largely built on draws.

previewParagraphs: The Bundesliga clash at Millerntor-Stadion pits St Pauli against RB Leipzig in a fixture where form and firepower come sharply into focus. As the home side strive to lift themselves from the bottom half of the table, Leipzig arrive as clear favorites, boasting one of the league's most potent attacks.

St Pauli's record in their last two home encounters against RB Leipzig offers a glimmer of encouragement. Across these matches, St Pauli have managed one win and one draw, notably avoiding defeat and demonstrating resilience on their own turf. However, history outside these two games points strongly in Leipzig's favor, with the visitors winning two out of the last three meetings and both of those victories by a margin of two or more goals.

St Pauli approach this fixture with mixed recent results. In their last six matches, they've claimed two wins, drawn twice and lost two times, while averaging just one goal for and 1.17 conceded per match. Their offensive output at home has been slight, with an average of only 0.67 goals scored across the last three matches at Millerntor-Stadion, conceding two per game in the same period.

Leipzig, meanwhile, show signs of consistency and firepower. Over their previous six matches, they've taken three wins, a single draw, and two defeats, with an impressive average of 2.17 goals scored per outing and only 1.17 conceded. The visitors generate plenty of chances, leading with an average of 16.83 total shots and 7.33 on target per game in this span. Notably, their away form features five wins from their last ten on the road in all competitions.

St Pauli's league position underscores their uphill challenge. After 15 matches, they sit 16th, with just three wins, three draws, and nine defeats, struggling with a negative goal difference of -13 and an average of only 0.87 goals per game. Defensively, they've allowed 1.73 goals per match, underlining the issues at both ends.

Leipzig, on the other hand, are entrenched in the top four after 15 matches. They boast nine wins, two draws, and four losses, with a healthy goal return of 30 (an even two per game) and a positive goal differential of +11. Their defense allows just 1.27 goals per outing, supporting their attacking work.

Looking further into the data, St Pauli have lost 50% of their last 22 matches in all competitions and have been winless in 12 out of their last 15 Bundesliga games. They have also lost six of their past 12 home league matches, highlighting ongoing struggles at Millerntor-Stadion. In 13 of their last 15 home games in the Bundesliga, they have failed to claim all three points.

RB Leipzig’s recent trends read much more favorably. They've emerged victorious in 12 of their last 20 games across competitions. They remain undefeated in 13 of their last 16 overall, and have a tendency to rack up significant wins: 39% of their last 28 matches have been won by at least two goals. On the road, they have kept a clean sheet in 42% of their past 12 away fixtures.

previewParagraphs: The Bundesliga resumes at Europa-Park Stadion as Freiburg prepares to host Hamburger SV. With both teams aiming to improve their mid-table positions, recent data strongly points toward a compelling encounter.

Freiburg enters this fixture with a favorable historical record against Hamburger SV, having won 3, drawn 2, and lost 1 in their last 6 meetings. This positive trend will surely give Julian Schuster’s side a boost.

Recent league form also tilts the scales toward Freiburg. Over their last 6 matches, they have secured 4 wins, 1 draw, and suffered just 1 defeat. With an average of 2.17 goals scored and only 1 conceded per match, Freiburg’s balance between attack and defense has been a key driver this season.

Home performances have been especially impressive. Across their last 3 matches at Europa-Park Stadion, Freiburg are unbeaten with 2 wins and 1 draw, conceding just 0.33 goals per game while producing an average of 20 total shots and dominated possession at 56%.

Much of this consistency stems from a stable lineup and tactical flexibility. Expect Freiburg to line up in their familiar 4-2-3-1 formation. Based on recent selections and squad health, the likely starting eleven should be:
Midfielders: Maximilian Eggestein, Patrick Osterhage, Philipp Treu, Yuito Suzuki, Johan Manzambi

Hamburger SV, on the other hand, come into this game in the midst of a patchy run. In their last 6 outings, Merlin Polzin’s team has won just twice, drawing 2 and losing 2 while averaging 1.17 goals scored and 1.5 conceded per match. Their struggles are even more pronounced on the road, where they’ve lost all of their last 3 away games, managed only 0.67 goals and conceded a worrying average of 3 per match.

Examining the trends over a larger sample, Hamburger SV have found it difficult to get results away from home. They have failed to win in 83% of their last 12 away matches across all competitions and suffered losses in 6 of those games. Additionally, they have lost by 2 or more goals in 43% of their last 7 away fixtures, reflecting ongoing defensive vulnerabilities.
The likely formation for Hamburger SV is the 3-4-3 they’ve favored recently, and their probable starting lineup looks like this:
Midfielders: Bakery Jatta, Albert Sambi Lokonga, Nicolai Remberg, Aboubaka Soumahoro

Considering league position after 15 matches, Freiburg sit 9th, boasting 5 wins, 5 draws, and 5 losses, with a nearly even goal difference. Hamburger SV are 13th, with 4 wins, 4 draws, and 7 losses while carrying a minus-9 goal differential. These standings reflect broader season trends, with Freiburg generally outperforming their guests.

In longer-term trends, Freiburg have collected 16 wins from their last 30 matches in all competitions and managed to remain undefeated in 24 of those fixtures. The home side has kept clean sheets in 40% of their last 10 Bundesliga home games and won by a margin of 2 or more goals in 40% of those as well.

The predictive model supports a Freiburg win at 42% probability, suggesting the home team’s solid form at Europa-Park Stadion could once again prove decisive. The algorithm forecasts a 3-1 result, aligning with Freiburg’s steady attacking output and Hamburger SV’s ongoing defensive frailties.

Overall, the metrics heavily favor Freiburg, whose consistent performances and reliable home record provide the foundation for a likely victory against a Hamburger SV side still seeking answers on their away travels.

previewParagraphs: Villarreal and Deportivo Alavés gear up for a competitive clash at the Estadio de la Cerámica as both teams look to advance their campaigns in La Liga. With Villarreal pushing for a secure place in the top four, this fixture offers them a key opportunity against an Alavés side still searching for consistency.

Recent encounters between Villarreal and Alavés have leaned slightly towards the Yellow Submarine. In the last 10 meetings, Villarreal have secured victory 5 times, while Alavés have won 3 and only 2 games have finished level. Notably, when Villarreal play host, they tend to come out on top, having taken 4 wins from the last 5 home matches against Alavés.

Looking at Villarreal's current form, their last 6 matches in all competitions have produced 2 wins, 1 draw, and 3 losses. During this stretch, they averaged 1.33 goals scored and matched that in goals conceded, highlighting a need for sharper defensive focus. Their shooting output, however, stands out with close to 20 total shots and 6 on target per match—showing strong ability to create goal-scoring chances, despite a slightly less than 50% possession share.

At home, Villarreal’s results remain a mixed bag. From their last 3 matches on their own patch, they have recorded 1 win and 2 defeats, with an average of 1.33 goals scored and 1.67 conceded per game. Their average shots on target dip slightly at home, and their possession drops to 45%, suggesting some vulnerability, particularly when pressed by visiting sides.

Historically, Villarreal’s record at the Estadio de la Cerámica is formidable. The hosts have not been defeated in 80% of their last 20 home matches in all competitions, and this number rises to an impressive 85% undefeated in their last 40 home matches in La Liga. Clean sheets have come in half of their last 12 home league games, and they’ve posted 17 wins over their past 30 league home fixtures. Adding to the optimism is a 67% rate of winning by 2 or more goals in their last 6 home meetings with Alavés.

Alavés arrive sitting 14th in the table with 18 games played, 5 wins, 4 draws, and 9 defeats. Their last 6 matches all told have seen 3 wins, a draw, and 2 losses, but their scoring rate remains modest at 1.17 goals per outing. Defensively, they've limited opponents to 1 goal on average, an improvement from their overall away record.

The away side have struggled for momentum on their travels, losing 50% of their last 14 away games in all competitions. Offensive output dips further in these matches, registering just over 4 shots on goal per away match. In La Liga, Alavés have not won in 8 of their last 10 league outings, a statistic that underlines their inconsistency.

Digging deeper into head-to-head statistics, Villarreal’s win count in recent home fixtures against Alavés is complemented by their ability to secure victories in convincing fashion. The hosts have won by 2 or more goals in 67% of their last 6 home matches against this opposition, while Alavés continue to seek ways to break their unfavorable away streaks.

The predicted starting elevens shed light on the resources at each coach’s disposal. Both teams are missing several players to injuries and suspensions, which adds complexity to lineup selection—particularly for Villarreal, who will be without contributors such as Alfonso Pedraza and Juan Foyth, and for Alavés, who miss Facundo Garcés and Antonio Sivera, among others.
Midfielders: Antonio Blanco (CDM), Denis Suárez, Pablo Ibáñez (CMs), Calebe, Abde Rebbach

With Villarreal showing a strong home record and a consistent ability to create chances, especially against Alavés, the projection leans towards a home victory. The prediction stands at Villarreal to take the points with a 61% likelihood, and a probable scoreline of 2-1, reflecting Alavés’ tenacity but also their ongoing away struggles.

previewParagraphs: As La Liga resumes at the Estadi Municipal de Montilivi, Girona gears up to face Osasuna in a matchup poised for a tactical battle. With both clubs seeking to find consistency this season, the clash offers a chance to gauge their ambitions for the rest of the campaign.

Girona comes into this encounter positioned 15th in the league with 18 matches under their belt. Their record stands at 4 wins, 6 draws, and 8 losses, with a total of 17 goals scored and 34 conceded, resulting in a goal difference of -17.

Osasuna holds 12th spot after 18 games, with 5 wins, 4 draws, and 9 defeats. They've managed 18 goals for and 21 against, with a -3 goal difference. Both sides have shown vulnerability at the back, but Osasuna’s numbers indicate a more balanced approach compared to Girona’s struggles.

The previous encounter between these teams was held on April 13, 2025, with Osasuna edging Girona 2-1 at home. Osasuna’s Ante Budimir and Pablo Ibáñez found the net, while Yáser Asprilla scored late for Girona. The match stats underline Girona’s attacking intent, with 19 total shots and 8 on target, alongside a whopping 68% possession. Osasuna, however, capitalized on their opportunities, converting 2 from their 6 shots on target despite only having 32% of the ball. This suggests Osasuna’s efficiency and ability to absorb pressure, while Girona’s attacking output hasn’t always translated to points.

Girona’s recent form has been mixed. In their last 6 matches, they have managed only 2 wins, 1 draw, and suffered 3 defeats. The attack has been muted, with an average of just 1 goal scored per game. Defensively, they have been porous, conceding an average of 1.83 goals per match. Their home record is also underwhelming, with one win, one draw, and one loss in the last three, netting just 0.67 goals per game.

Statistically, Girona has lost 50% of their last 6 home league matches and have been winless in 81% of their last 37 La Liga games. However, they have managed to remain undefeated in 5 of their last 6 home matches, hinting at a recent improvement in resilience at the Montilivi.

On the other hand, Osasuna have recorded 3 wins in their past 6, losing just once. Their attack has been more productive, averaging 2 goals per match. They have been hard to break down on the road, drawing half of their recent away games. Notably, Osasuna haven’t been defeated in 6 of their last 7 matches across all competitions.

Osasuna’s away day difficulties have lingered, though. They have been winless in 87% of their last 15 away games and have lost 10 of their past 20 on the road. However, a 50% clean sheet rate in their last 15 home league matches and an improvement in their defensive unit offers optimism.

In terms of squad availability, Girona will be without Azzedine Ounahi, Donny van de Beek, Portu, Cristhian Stuani and Juan Carlos due to various injuries. For Osasuna, Iker Benito, Enzo Boyomo and long-term absentee Javi Galán are unavailable.

Tactically, expect Girona to stick with a 4-2-3-1, focusing on a compact midfield and utilising the pace of Tsygankov and Bryan Gil out wide. Osasuna may mirror this with their own 4-2-3-1, looking for Oroz and García to supply Budimir up front.

Forecasts highlight the likelihood of a closely contested battle, with both teams struggling for cutting edge recently. Analytical models suggest a draw (1-1) as the most probable outcome, with a predicted 39% probability and an expectation for under 2.5 total goals.
With both sides evenly matched and history suggesting tight encounters, this fixture looks set to be determined by defensive resolve and opportunism in front of goal.

previewParagraphs: Bayer Leverkusen welcome Stuttgart to the BayArena with both teams riding mini undefeated streaks and showing strong attacking intent this Bundesliga campaign. With stout recent records and impressive trends on both sides, this encounter is set up as a pivotal clash in the battle for the top spots.

Looking at the last six meetings between Bayer Leverkusen and Stuttgart, Leverkusen have built a remarkable record without suffering a loss, tallying two wins and four draws. Stuttgart have been competitive, but have failed to get the better of their hosts over this stretch.
When casting a wider lens, the dominance stands out. Leverkusen have won 63% of the last 19 matches against Stuttgart, cementing a sustained upper hand over the visiting side in head-to-head battles.

Leverkusen enter this fixture after recording three wins, one draw, and two losses in their last six matches across all competitions. Their attack has provided an average of 1.5 goals per match, while their defense conceded an average of 1.17. Notably, their home record across three recent matches is evenly split with a win, draw, and loss each, but with a higher scoring rate of 1.67 goals per match.

Stuttgart have generated similar recent results, matching Leverkusen with three wins, one draw, and two losses in their own last six. Stuttgart’s attack has been slightly sharper, averaging 1.83 goals per match, but they’ve seen a marginally looser defense with 1.33 goals conceded per outing.

Leverkusen currently stand third in the Bundesliga with a very strong record: nine wins, two draws, and four losses from 15 games, racking up 33 goals (2.2 per match) and a healthy plus-13 goal difference. They have blended attacking punch with strong defensive numbers at home, impressing with an average possession of over 58% in recent home fixtures.

Stuttgart are not far behind in sixth place, boasting eight wins, two draws, and five defeats. They’ve scored 25 and conceded 22, giving them a goal difference of plus-3. Their average possession also trends high, above 60% in recent matches, indicating an intent to control games.

Leverkusen are in compelling long-term form, undefeated in 24 of their last 30 matches in all competitions. At the BayArena, they’ve been especially tough to beat, having avoided defeat in 80% of their last 30 home fixtures. Defensively, they’ve kept clean sheets in 40% of their last 10 at home.

The home side are also capable of winning big, earning wins by two or more goals in five of their last 12 matches. When hosting Stuttgart, Leverkusen have claimed wins by a margin of two or more in four of their last 10 meetings.

Stuttgart have shown strength as travelers, going undefeated in eight of their last 10 matches across all competitions. Their defense away from home has provided clean sheets in 42% of the last 12 games, while their attack has won six of the last 12 on the road.

previewParagraphs: Twente return to De Grolsch Veste eager to set the record straight after a stinging loss to PEC Zwolle earlier in the season. The stage is set for a contest between two sides with contrasting ambitions and momentum as the Eredivisie regular season continues.

The most recent meeting between PEC Zwolle and Twente saw the home side come out on top 1-0 when they clashed on August 10, 2025. Thijs Oosting scored the only goal of that match inside eight minutes.
Statistically, Twente controlled much of the game but could not convert their superiority. They held 57% of the ball and created 51 dangerous attacks compared to 46 from PEC Zwolle.

Twente outshot their hosts 16 to 7 and managed 4 shots on target, but clinical finishing proved elusive. Despite these efforts, Zwolle’s steadfast defending and early breakthrough were enough to seal a narrow victory.

Twente approach this fixture with growing confidence. They have not lost any of their last 6 matches, picking up 3 wins and 3 draws. Over their last 9 matches in all competitions, they remain undefeated. In their last three home games, they secured two victories and a draw while conceding no goals.

PEC Zwolle have faced rougher waters. In their last 6 outings, they recorded 2 wins, 1 draw, and 3 defeats. Their attacking output averages just 1.33 goals per match, but defensively, they have struggled, conceding an average of 2.33.
On the road, PEC Zwolle are experiencing significant challenges. Out of their last 10 away matches in all competitions, they have been winless in 8 and lost half of those contests.

Twente sit 6th in the Eredivisie table after 17 rounds, gathering 6 wins, 7 draws, and 4 defeats with a positive goal difference of +5. Their average output stands at 1.53 goals scored per game and 1.24 conceded.

PEC Zwolle currently occupy 14th, having notched 5 wins and 4 draws but suffering 8 defeats. Goal difference is a clear concern for Johnny Jansen’s men at -17, as they have shipped 38 goals in 17 matches—2.24 conceded per game—while only scoring 21.

Twente's home form continues to be a strong foundation. They are undefeated in 86% of their last 7 home fixtures in the Eredivisie and achieved clean sheets in 43% of their past 30 home league games. Historically against Zwolle, Twente have found joy – they’ve won 83% of their last 6 home matches and half of those by at least two goals.

For PEC Zwolle, defensive fragility on the road is demonstrated by losing by two or more goals in 12 of their last 34 away matches. They have also gone winless in 80% of their past 15 league games and have lost 50% of their previous 10 away ties in all competitions.
